physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient admitted for treatment of right leg-stump infection.
Culture of stump drainage fluid grew MRSA resistant to most antibiotics tested but susceptible to vancomycin and rifampin.
Cultures indicated the presence of MRSA in the patient's nares.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No change specified after therapy, MRSA persisted despite treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Culture of patient's nares failed to grow MRSA.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Concurrent culture of patient's wife's nares grew MRSA for the first time.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient developed another bout of MRSA infection in his leg stump despite a negative nares culture result.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: MRSA infection occurred despite previously negative cultures.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient presented with a new pressure ulcer above the right leg stump. No evidence of MRSA infection around the ulcer.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial ulcer with no MRSA infection.
